entry.strongs_def: royalty, i.e. (abstractly) rule, or (concretely) a realm (literally or figuratively); kingdom, + reign.
to think differently or afterwards, i.e. reconsider (morally, feel compunction); repent.

entry.strongs_derivation: perhaps from the same as G3735 (through the idea of elevation);
entry.strongs_def: the sky; by extension, heaven (as the abode of God); by implication, happiness, power, eternity; specifically, the Gospel (Christianity); air, heaven(-ly), sky.
to make near, i.e. (reflexively) approach; approach, be at hand, come (draw) near, be (come, draw) nigh.

entry.strongs_derivation: a prolonged form of the poetical μάκαρ (meaning the same);
entry.strongs_def: supremely blest; by extension, fortunate, well off; blessed, happy(× -ier).
a beggar (as cringing), i.e. pauper (strictly denoting absolute or public mendicancy); figuratively, distressed; beggar(-ly), poor.
a current of air, i.e. breath (blast) or a breeze; by analogy or figuratively, a spirit; ghost, life, spirit(-ual, -ually), mind.

entry.strongs_derivation: the first person singular present indicative;
entry.strongs_def: a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist (used only when emphatic); am, have been, × it is I, was.
to herald (as a public crier), especially divine truth (the gospel); preach(-er), proclaim, publish.
properly, to "lay" forth, i.e. (figuratively) relate (in words); by implication, to mean; ask, bid, boast, call, describe, give out, name, put forth, say(-ing, on), shew, speak, tell, utter.
